img_above_text:
There's not too much else in the field around the high tower, but you can find a green Wisp to absorb both behind the tower, and along the nearby cliff wall below a large statue where a Crow Diviner enemy stands.
Head back to the main road and defeat the various Frozen Corpses while you head toward a large arch where the Shrine is, plus a green Wisp to absorb.
img_below_text:
Guarding the Shrine is another Dual-Blade Monk, who thankfully won't respawn when killed, so feel free to go all out with your spells to overpower him after deflecting an attack to stagger him.
![Wukong Longevity 9.jpg](https://oyster.ignimgs.com/mediawiki/apis.ign.com/black-myth-wukong/1/1c/Wukong_Longevity_9.jpg)

Head back to the main road and defeat the various Frozen Corpses while you head toward a large arch where the Shrine is, plus a green Wisp to absorb."
        - Following Text: "Guarding the Shrine is another Dual-Blade Monk, who thankfully won't respawn when killed, so feel free to go all out with your spells to overpower him after deflecting an attack to stagger him.

img_summary: The image depicts a scene from *Black Myth: Wukong*, showing the player character engaging in combat near a snowy shrine area. A Frozen Corpse enemy stands in front of a wooden archway, while the player character wields a staff and prepares to attack. The interface displays abilities, health, and "Will" resources, indicating active gameplay. This area is described as being on the path to a shrine guarded by a Dual-Blade Monk, who is mentioned in the following text.
